RISK MANAGEMENT PROGRAM
EXECUTIVE SUMMARY


1.0	Accidental Release Prevention and Emergency Response Policies

The Municipal Authority of Westmoreland County Indian Creek Supply Filtration Plant is committed to the safety of our workers, the public, and the environment.  The resources invested in the prevention of accidental releases of hazardous substances demonstrate this commitment.  
The Municipal Authority of Westmoreland County Indian Creek Supply Filtration Plant implements reasonable controls, such as training of personnel and the safe design, installation, operation and maintenance of our processes.  
Our policy is to make every effort to prevent the release of hazardous substances but in the event of a release, our trained personnel will coordinate with local emergency response agencies and first responders to control and contain the release in a manner that will be safe for workers and will help prevent injuries to the public or the environment.


2.0	Description of The Municipal Authority of Westmoreland County Indian Creek Supply Filtration Plant and Regulated Substances

The Municipal Authority of Westmoreland County Indian Creek Supply Filtration Plant handles one substance regulated by the Risk Management Plan Rule (RMP Rule) in quantities above the Threshold Quantity.  This substance is: Chlorine

* Chlorine - stored in 1 ton cylinders and used for disinfection of the water prior to distribution.

4.3	Operating Procedures

The Municipal Authority of Westmoreland County  Indian Creek Supply Filtration Plant develops and maintains operating procedures to define how tasks related to process operations should be performed.  The operating procedures are used to:

1. train employees and contractors, and
2. serve as reference guides for appropriate actions to take during both normal and abnormal process conditions.

4.4	Training

The Municipal Authority of Westmoreland County Indian Creek Supply Filtration Plant trains personnel in the operating procedures to help ensure safe and effective performance of their assigned tasks. A record of all training is maintained to help ensure new and refresher training is provided on a timely basis.

4.5	Maintenance

The Municipal Authority of Westmoreland County Indian Creek Supply Filtration Plant properly maintains the equipment in our processes.  The Municipal Authority of Westmoreland County Indian Creek Supply Filtration Plant maintenance program includes:

1. procedures to safely guide workers in their maintenance tasks,
2. worker training in the maintenance procedures, and
3. inspection and testing program to help identify equipment deterioration and damage before equipment fails.

4.6	Compliance Audits

The Municipal Authority of Westmoreland County Indian Creek Supply Filtration Plant performs periodic (at least every three years) audits of covered processes to verify the processes are operating in compliance with the requirements of the RMP Rule.  A compliance audit report is prepared after each audit, and any deficiencies noted by the audit are corrected in a timely manner.


4.7	Incident Investigations

The Municipal Authority of Westmoreland County Indian Creek Supply Filtration Plant investigates all incidents that could reasonably have resulted in a serious injury to personnel, the public, or the environm

ent.  The Municipal Authority of Westmoreland County Indian Creek Supply Filtration Plant trains employees to identify and report any and all incidents requiring investigation.  An investigation team is assembled and the investigation is initiated within 48 hours of the incident.  The results of the investigation are documented, recommendations are resolved, and appropriate process enhancements are implemented.

4.8	Chemical-specific Prevention Steps - Chlorine

Industry standards are followed at The Municipal Authority of Westmoreland County Indian Creek Supply Filtration Plant to help ensure safe handling of Chlorine.  The vendor supplies Chlorine via a Department of Transportation (DOT) approved truck and in DOT approved 1 ton cylinders.  The process equipment is designed and constructed with state-of-the-art materials and technology utilizing the standards and guidelines of the Chlorine Institute, American Water Works Association, ASME, ANSI, and other applicable codes.  Workers who perform operations involving Chlorine receive training emphasizing safe handling procedures according to the guidelines required by The Municipal Authority of Westmoreland County Indian Creek Supply Filtration Plant.


5.0	Five Year Accident History

There has been no accidents or incidents that resulted in injuries to employee, the public, or the environment at The Municipal Authority of Westmoreland County Indian Creek Supply Filtration Plant in the past five years.


6.0	Emergency Response Programs

The Municipal Authority of Westmoreland County Indian Creek Supply Filtration Plant has prepared a written emergency action plan that complies with the RMP Rule, other federal standards and industry guidelines.  This plan has been communicated to the Local Emergency Planning Committee LEPC/EMA and local fire department.
